page.title: 19TOURISM IN CHILMARK/TEFFONT
page.content: {Chilmark}and{Teffont Magna}lie on {one }of the chief routes westward from Salisbury, nowadays called the B3089. An ancient road, the{Oxdrove,}lies two miles north of the villages and the A303 a mile futher north. Many travellers must have passed along these routes and stopped at the{Black {Dog Inn}since it was built in the 15th century. The{Chilmark Garage}with full servicing facilities and petrol is only 50 yards from the inn. Visitors come to the area not only on their way to the west, but from America, especially from Chilmark, Massachusets to visit ancestors in the churchyard. {Ponytrekkers}from{Codford}in the Wylye valley have lunch at the Black Dog and visitors come to shoot deer with local landowners. AMcG.
